cyclone.name: FIONA
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles ESE of St. Croix
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west to west-northwest toward the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico, then curving northwest toward the Dominican Republic and the southern Bahamas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern or eastern coast of the Dominican Republic

weather_observation.watch_coast: Dominica and the south coast of the Dominican Republic from Cabo Caucedo to Barahona
weather_observation.warning_coast: Antigua and Barbuda through the northern Leeward Islands, U.S. & British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico (including Vieques & Culebra), and the Dominican Republic from Cabo Engano to Puerto Plata
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, eastern & southern Dominican Republic, Turks and Caicos
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) with higher gusts possible Saturday afternoon through Sunday evening; a brief period near hurricane strength cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft of surge and localized coastal flooding possible, mainly along the southern coast of Puerto Rico including the San Juan harbor entrance at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches widespread with isolated amounts up to 12 inches, producing flash flooding and urban flooding; mudslides possible in higher terrain.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and life-threatening rip currents beginning Saturday.
